goal_description: Book a flight from NYC to SFO.

golden_trace.text: book flight from NYC to SFO tomorrow.
Okay, I can help with that. Could you please provide the specific date for 'tomorrow'?
Alright, I found a couple of flights for you on September 15th, 2024 from JFK to SFO: Flight UA123 departing at 09:30 for $550, and AA456 departing at 11:00 for $580. Which one would you like?
Excellent! Your flight UA123 is confirmed. Your booking ID is BK12345. Have a great trip!

assertions.name: outcome_simple_booking_success
assertions.description: Verify the correct flight was successfully booked and confirmed.
assertions.prompt_template: Did the agent successfully book a flight? Answer only YES or NO.

assertions.name: trajectory_clarify_date
assertions.description: Agent asks for the specific date when only 'tomorrow' is given.
assertions.prompt_template: The user initially asked for a flight 'tomorrow'. Did the Agent, in its *first* response, ask the user to provide a specific date? Answer only YES or NO.

assertions.name: trajectory_search_intent
assertions.description: Agent used search tool with correct intent.
assertions.prompt_template: Based on the user's request, did the agent invoke the flight search tool with arguments matching this origin, destination, and date? Answer only YES or NO.

assertions.name: trajectory_present_options
assertions.description: Agent presented flight options clearly after searching.
assertions.prompt_template: After searching for flights, did the Agent present one or more specific flight options to the user, including identifiable details like flight numbers/IDs and prices? Answer only YES or NO.

assertions.name: trajectory_book_intent
assertions.description: Agent used booking tool with the user's chosen flight (UA123).
assertions.prompt_template: Did the agent invoke the flight booking tool?
